title: Advice climbing out of Silver 2
body:
I've been to Silver 2 multiple times, and peaked around 90LP. After a certain point, I just fall back down into Silver 3 and have to re-climb back out.

I don't know what else I can do, or try. I mainly use {{champion:412}} {{champion:201}} {{champion:111}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:12}} {{champion:43}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:54}} 

I have tried other roles as well, but cannot seem to carry as much. I usually end up doing something that costs the game, or there comes a point in the late game where it is harder to get a kill.

I would like some advice from higher ELO support mains on what they do that keeps them climbing. I know it is also a team effort, and not only on the support. That being said, I do try to build around the team based on champ select, as well as into the enemy team.

*Disclaimer, I have already been told "you can't carry as support, and to find another role". I don't believe that to be true.

Thanks,

replies.body:
"you can't carry as support, and to find another role"
Utility is very OP at higher Elo. Supports are OP starting in high plat / diamond. 

Sadly, until then, and particularly in Bronze/Silver, utility champ are useless. Ward won't bring much, most players won't use them anyway. 
Same for a good Karma shield or a good Alistar combo. 

If you don't want to play carry champ... the only solution I see for you is to find a good ADC to duo with. An ADC that can use your good support skill, and both of you can carry. 
Out-cs your opponents in bot, put some wards and don't get killed, get first blood turret and then rotate mid, get drakes...

I'm starting to abandon that mentality of building around the team, and to just dish out damage while providing peel for the team.

That's a great idea. 
I used to play Annie support when I was Silver/Gold, it worked very well. 
Just get sighstone to ward, but other than that, you can get fed by getting tons of kill botlane, then roam and kill everywhere, and be like a 2nd mid carry without taking any cs. 

It works, but to me, it's not the most interesting way to play league. 
Sadly, that's what work at low elo.

I have enjoyed playing Lulu. I've been keeping my adc up and provide the utility to keep others alive as well.

Although it isn't true that you can't carry as a support, it is much harder than other roles unless you do just damage supports. Like I play almost exclusively Janna when I get autofilled, I have over a 5 kda on her and a 60 something% win rate even though I am only low plat and my coach and friends who are in diamond use to tell me you can't carry as a Janna in low plat. Why? Well in low plat the mechanics and game knowledge aren't high enough to allow a Janna to usually carry because she does nearly no damage and mainly displaces the enemy to protect her carries. The only reason I do well with Janna is that I still get a competent damage carry and even then I need to play a very clean game to keep that carry alive because people in plat still make a lot of mistakes.

Carrying as support in silver is far harder with nearly all the champs you shown because you lack damage, and with the low quality of mechanics in silver, you can't rely on being able to only support them and have a consistent win rate.

Thank you so much for this input. I still think your good if you made it low plat, and this is coming from high silver. I will start going back to my roots, I usually choose the support tank because we will have a squishy team comp, or if we lack the CC. I understand that damage is a primary focus for mid game. I will revisit Janna, I've gone up against some pretty good ones, and she has a great kit!

Janna is amazing if you have one good carry, doesn't have to be the adc, because she makes them nearly impossible to kill if that person isn't crazy and try to engage all the time without the support. Wouldn't recommend her for a main until you hit gold 1 mmr at the very least. Good supports for silver are damage supports or high initiation like a leona. People in silver are usually careless with their positioning so you can get a lot of early picks and snowball that for early leads.

I see what you mean. I use the LOLSUMO app, (Not entirely sure how accurate it is, I've tried to find sources for each claim) but most all of my performances are Plat/Diamond.
I used Lulu last game, and I did relatively great. 0/2/16 we had 24 team kills when we won. I got an A+ though... but I forgot how OP she can be if you're in the right place at the right time.

You can carry as support.  Do you have all the basics down, look up good places to ward for each objective and point in the game, how to zone in lane and what zones of control mean.

Also look up guides for all your champions, often you'll find extra tricks for your champions to utilize in matchups and most guides also tell you what you should be doing with them at most points in the game (early mid and late).  

If you can I reccomend douing with an adc as it makes communication soo much better in bot lane and you also know exactly what to expect from your lane partner.

I have all of the basics down, mechanically speaking, I know I have to work on falling back on the ADC to protect. But in terms of peeling in lane, and ganks, as well as disengages, I have that down. I have been looking up crucial ward spots, and I have been adjusting that. I ward frequently both enemy jungle (when I can) when roaming, and I don't keep too many wards in close proximity. I ping when I see the jungler on other places of the map.

I will look up the tricks on some of them. 

I duo with a friend when I can, and when they're not on, I try in champ select to ask who they prefer for Supports, and if that goes well, then the basic pings in lane work.

Thank you!

Typically from my experience you'll want things like {{champion:37}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:117}}  who secure midgame advantages for your team. In lower elo this is where EVERYTHING happens. If you've messed up in other roles then you need to practice this portion of the game.

You play ADC like Ashe/Tristana a lot too, so you should be asking advice for those too I feel like. If you prefer support for solo gameplay then you should be putting more effort into practicing that.

Blitzcrank is extremely dependent on landing hooks in lane and pressuring the enemy to answer him. For example, you have your jungler coming down to gank and the river isn't warded, so he's going to go in. Your job is to push W and *walk up* to the enemy with your E, then using hook to grab them after they likely flash or something. Otherwise you want to prioritize landing hooks, especially vs. ranged supports. Blitz does not do well vs. tank supports, so you should probably switch to Braum/Thresh if possible on those cases.

As with any champion, spectate high elo vids and see how they play the early game, note where they are on the map at mid-game and most importantly what objectives are up. Keep track of their scores and see what they do when they're ahead vs. when they're behind. It'll help a lot more than generic advice.

Thank you so much for your input! I typically took the tanks for CC or because we lack the tank presence. But I see what you're saying. I will have to go back to my mage roots. Last season and one prior I had high win rates with Lulu, Karma and Soraka. It also helped me climb then too. I started going as ADC because I found myself losing more games as Support. I don't often pass blame, but I have had a string of incompetent ADCs who when they get behind, despite informing them to just farm it out to catch up, they often try to engage and solo kill and tilt themselves. It happens, I am one to deescalate the situation always. I believe you can always claw back in it. Sadly, this mentality is not often shared.
I use Ashe and Trist as they have good engage and disengage and with Trist's resets, it makes hopping in and out of team fights good. As with Ashe, landing a good arrow can turn a fight. I have decent ADC mechanics, there are just times where that is not enough. I make mistakes, and I own up to them, but sometimes a careless mistake can cost the game.

I've been on forums, Youtube, etc looking for good Support stuff, and sadly there aren't any on Twitch anymore.

Honestly I'm just getting back into ranked. I always start every season around silver and end up gold 1 or low play. I just never play the game consistently and it ends up losing all LP

Personally, despite being a good player, I really think it's all about trying to keep your team positive and motivated to win. I swear to god my game yesterday if you watch the replay, top lane Shen goes 0/3/0 by 4 minutes in the game. He starts saying it's GG, it's over..etc. the both lane gets killed and starts arguing that one or the other is an idiot. Our jungle complains that he can't farm. I think I spent more time typing trying to reassure the team that it's okay, it's fine that they fed, that we can still pull through.

Personally, deep down we should have lost but I was able to get ahead of the Ahri to the point I was 9/0/0 and we kinda just kept picking them off while making sure that no one fights

My point is, as long as you can win your lane, I think the biggest thing is to keep your cool and make sure no one goes bat *** crazy

I keep calm, and I try to deescalate the problem. Sometimes it is on me to make a good support play to get team back, other times, my efforts to resolve the team problem, make me the bad guy. I always comment "nj nj" when someone gets a kill, or if we punish an over extend, or even if the person who is "feeding" gets a kill to bring him back up. I do my best to win lane, and I do my best to catch up when we lose the lane, I take full responsibility if I get caught out, I recognize when I am the problem. 

It is really important to keep a level head, I agree. I am trying to do everything I can to break out of this mold. So all of this advice is good to read. I appreciate it. You can always spectate my games, and let me know after. I try to find people to do that too.
